Male

choices.text: Father
Mother

elements.name: orderSought
elements.title: What is the Director applying for? / What authority of CFCSA were the children removed under?

choices.text: `s. 30 health and safety in immediate danger`
`s. 30 no less disruptive available measure is adequate`

elements.name: childrenReturned
elements.title:
Have the child(ren) been returned to the parents

[If the social worker selects s. 29.1, this question would stay invisible and the form would say "children remain in the care of the parents"]

[This question can be asked for each child individually if preferred.]

elements.name: hearingDate
elements.title: Hearing Date

elements.name: hearingTime
elements.title: Hearing Time

elements.name: hearingLocation
elements.title: Hearing Location [default to user's location]

elements.name: question26
elements.title:
This service will validate that all questions have been answered. (Form A vs Form F has already been chosen through the options selected on Form 1).

The social worker can now eFile the Presentation Form 1.

elements.name: reportLaterType
elements.title: Which Report to Court are you planning to bring to the presentation hearing? [would not need to ask this question?]

choices.text: Form A
Form F

elements.name: reportNowOrLater
elements.title: Are ready to continue with your Report to Court?

choices.text: I want to continue filling out the Report to Court
I want to file the Presentation Form 1 first and fill out the Report to Court separately

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What date was/were the child(ren) removed?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What time was/were the child(ren) removed?

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Location of Removal

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Who was present when the child(ren) was/were removed?
elements.description: (first list the person removing the child and then any other person(s) present at the time of the removal)

elements.name: question8
elements.title: The circumstances that caused the director to remove the child(ren) are as follows:

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Is/was the child is living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child lives?
elements.description: Domestic Violence The likelihood of physical harm to a child increases when the child is living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child resides (section 13(1.2)).

elements.name: question9
elements.title: The child was removed in accordance with the following:
elements.description: section 30 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act in the following circumstance(s) as described by section 13 of the Act:

choices.text: (a) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed by the child's parent
(b) the child has been, or is likely to be, sexually abused or exploited by the child's parent
(c) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed, sexually abused or sexually exploited by another person and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to protect the child
(d) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed because of neglect by the child's parent
(e)(i) the child is emotionally harmed by the parent's conduct
(e)(ii) the child is emotionally harmed by living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child resides
(f) the child is deprived of necessary health care
(g) the child's development is likely to be seriously impaired by a treatable condition and the child's parent refuses to provide or consent to treatment
(h) the child's parent is unable or unwilling to care for the child and has not made adequate provision for the child's care
(i) the child is or has been absent from home in circumstances that endanger the child's safety or wellbeing
(j) the child's parent is dead and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(k) the child has been abandoned and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(i) the child is in the care of a director or another person by agreement and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to resume care when the agreement is no longer in force

elements.name: question13
elements.title: The following less disruptive measures were considered before removing the child(ren)

elements.title: Interim Plan of Care
elements.description: The child's current living arrangement is as follows:

elements.name: question25
elements.title: Is/was the child is living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child lives?
elements.description: Domestic Violence The likelihood of physical harm to a child increases when the child is living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child resides (section 13(1.2)).

elements.name: question11
elements.title: section 36 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:

choices.text: (i) an order made under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or 36 (3) of the Act no longer protects the child;

(ii) a person has not complied with a term or condition of an order under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) of the Act and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.

elements.description: Domestic Violence The likelihood of physical harm to a child increases when the child is living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child resides (section 13(1.2)).

elements.name: question12
elements.title: section 42 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:

choices.text: (i) that a supervision order made under section 41 (1) (a) or (b), (1.1) or (2.1), 42.2 (4) (a) or (c), 46 (3), 49 (8) or 54.01 (10) of the Act or an interim order made under section 42.1 of the Act no longer protects the child;
(ii) a person has not complied with a term or condition of the supervision or interim order and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.

elements.name: question30
elements.title: Grounds for Making the Application

elements.name: question2
elements.title: The director has reasonable grounds to believe that the child(ren) need(s) protection due to the existence of the following circumstance(s) as described by s. 13 of the CFCSA Act:

choices.text: (a) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed by the child's parent
(b) the child has been, or is likely to be, sexually abused or exploited by the child's parent
(c) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed, sexually abused or sexually exploited by another person and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to protect the child
(d) the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed because of neglect by the child's parent
(e)(i) the child is emotionally harmed by the parent's conduct
(e)(ii) the child is emotionally harmed by living in a situation where there is domestic violence by or towards a person with whom the child resides
(f) the child is deprived of necessary health care
(g) the child's development is likely to be seriously impaired by a treatable condition and the child's parent refuses to provide or consent to treatment
(h) the child's parent is unable or unwilling to care for the child and has not made adequate provision for the child's care
(i) the child is or has been absent from home in circumstances that endanger the child's safety or wellbeing
(j) the child's parent is dead and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(k) the child has been abandoned and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(i) the child is in the care of a director or another person by agreement and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to resume care when the agreement is no longer in force
